data.value: This function figures out where each slice should start in each block for a single dimension. If the slice won't return any elements in the block, that block will not be in the output.
This should be a positive, non-zero integer

children.param: dim_shape - the number of elements in this dimension.

data.value: This should be a positive, non-zero integer

children.param: blocksize - the number of elements per block in this dimension

data.value: This might be an integer, a slice(), or an Ellipsis

children.param: index - a description of the elements in this dimension that we want

data.value: should be sliced and the values are the slices

children.type_: dictionary where the keys are the integer index of the blocks that

data.out: {0: slice(None, None, None), 1: slice(None, None, None)}

data.value: 100 length array cut into length 20 pieces, slice 0:35
Support irregular blocks and various slices
